licence_overview:
To run a laying hen establishment with over 350 hens for eggs that are being supplied to the Class A egg market you need to be registered with [Animal Health Veterinary Laboratories Agency](http://www.defra.gov.uk/ahvla/ "Animal Health Veterinary Laboratories Agency"){:rel="external"} in England and Wales.

Applications must include:

* the name and address of the establishment
* farming method(s) used - eg caged, barn, free range or organic
* maximum capacities for each farming method used, including the maximum number of laying hens present at one time for each method
* the name and address of the keeper and owner if different
* the registration number of any other establishment kept or owned by the keeper and owner, if applicable

##Conditions

You must: 

* let authorised officers access to your premises. 
* provide information or assistance needed by them 
* not provide false information

You must notify [Animal Health Veterinary Laboratories Agency](http://www.defra.gov.uk/ahvla/ "Animal Health Veterinary Laboratories Agency"){:rel="external"} with 28 days of any changes to the information detailed in your registration.

##Fines and penalities

% If you fail to comply with requirements, you may commit a criminal offence and be fined up to £2,500 and/or imprisoned for up to three months. %
